title: The Score: How to Stop Playing Somebody Else's Game
author: C. Thi Nguyen
notes: A philosopher's exploration of how scoring systems and gamification shape our values — and how to reclaim what we actually care about.

title: In Praise of Shadows
author: Jun'ichirō Tanizaki
notes: A meditation on Japanese aesthetics — darkness, subtlety, and the beauty of things partially hidden.

title: The Magic Mountain
author: Thomas Mann
notes: A young man's visit to a Swiss sanatorium stretches from weeks into years — a novel of ideas exploring time, illness, and European intellectual life.

title: Anarchy, State, and Utopia
author: Robert Nozick
notes: A libertarian philosophical classic arguing for a minimal state, challenging Rawls's theory of justice with a rights-based framework.

title: On Being Ill
author: Virginia Woolf
notes: A luminous essay on the strange, overlooked experience of illness — and how the sick body reshapes perception, language, and consciousness.
